an3.22:4.1: “These three patients are found in the world.
an3.22:4.3: In some cases a patient won’t recover from an illness, regardless of whether or not they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer.
an3.22:5.1: In some cases a patient will recover from an illness, regardless of whether or not they get suitable food or medicines, and a capable carer.
an3.22:6.1: In some cases a patient can recover from an illness, but only if they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer, and not if they don’t get these things.
an3.22:7.1: Now, it’s for the sake of the last patient—who will recover only if they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer—that food, medicines, and a carer are prescribed.
an3.22:7.2: But also, for the sake of this patient, the other patients should be looked after.
an3.22:7.3: These are the three people found in the world.
an3.22:8.1: So too, these three people similar to patients are found among the mendicants.
an3.22:8.3: Some people don’t arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities, regardless of whether or not they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he announces.
an3.22:9.1: Some people do arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities, regardless of whether or not they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he announces.
an3.22:10.1: Some people can arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities, but only if they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he announces, and not when they don’t get those things.
an3.22:11.1: Now, it’s for the sake of this last person—who can arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities, but only if they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he announces—that teaching the Dharma is prescribed.
an3.22:11.2: But also, for the sake of this person, the other people should be taught Dharma.
an3.22:11.3: These are the three people similar to patients found in the world.”
